scenario: A BCBA develops comprehensive treatment for a 8-year-old with intellectual disability showing multiple problem behaviors. Assessment reveals multiple maintaining functions. Treatment must address function-based intervention using multi-component approach.
question: What approach is most appropriate for complex cases?
options: Address one issue at a time
Implement comprehensive individualized function-based treatment
Use standard protocol regardless of assessment
Focus only on most severe behavior
explanation: Complex cases require comprehensive, individualized, function-based approaches addressing all maintaining variables and skill deficits simultaneously. Sequential treatment of single issues may be less efficient. Standard protocols ignore individual differences. Addressing only severe behavior neglects other important targets. Best practice combines functional assessment, individualized intervention, and multi-component treatment.

scenario: A BCBA develops comprehensive treatment for a 9-year-old with intellectual disability showing complex skill deficits. Assessment reveals various skill needs. Treatment must address skill acquisition using individualized protocols.

options: Address one issue at a time
Implement comprehensive individualized function-based treatment
Use standard protocol regardless of assessment

Best practice combines functional assessment, individualized intervention, and multi-component treatment.

Best practice combines functional assessment, individualized intervention, and multi-component treatment.
